border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>Vaccine stockpiles protect South Sudanese refugees against cholera.</p></description><pubDate>Tue, 24 Feb 2015 14:32:00 -0800</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Helen Matzger</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/F/FA-FE/fc248850f48256bdf524ba697d23431b77b2ff5__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Vaccines</topic><program>Health</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{772C51ED-5A3B-460D-ADE0-DB3A6682A985}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2015/01/Witnessing-the-Democratic-Republic-of-the-Congo-Transform-Vaccination-Programs-Firsthand</link><a10:author><a10:name>Enrique Paz</a10:name></a10:author><title>Witnessing the Democratic Republic of the Congo Transform Vaccination Programs Firsthand</title><description><div style="text-align: left; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>Some of the world\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds leading artists show how vaccines have transformed the world.</p></description><pubDate>Thu, 15 Jan 2015 07:37:00 -0800</pubDate><numberOfComments>2</numberOfComments><author>Orin Levine</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/M/MA-ME/mauroperucchettihero803x1024-1488972ee8d15431aa6a5e43c3ba323da__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Vaccines</topic><program>Health</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{30D1DBD7-D16C-48B9-8C85-7FF39777E8D5}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2015/01/Elevating-Art-to-Advance-Science-A-New-View-of-Vaccination-in-2015</link><a10:author><a10:name>Christopher Elias</a10:name></a10:author><title>Elevating Art to Advance Science: A New View of Vaccination in 2015</title><description><div style="text-align: left; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>More than 30 artists come together around The Art of Saving a Life project to support global vaccination efforts.</p></description><pubDate>Mon, 12 Jan 2015 14:40:22 -0800</pubDate><numberOfComments>1</numberOfComments><author>Christopher Elias</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/A/AP-AZ/art-of-saving-a-life-2014alexiasinclairvariolaver771b744d2ea04dd5b0c7082101b252f5__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Vaccines</topic><program>Health</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{AF324CFC-DD8A-4168-ACD8-63ADF5F7EB7D}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/12/Supply-Chain-Experts-Take-a-Cue-from-Fruit-Fly-Research</link><a10:author><a10:name>David Sarley</a10:name></a10:author><title>Supply Chain Experts Take a Cue from Fruit Fly Research</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/12/Supply-Chain-Experts-Take-a-Cue-from-Fruit-Fly-Research"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/D/DA-DE/david-sarley-frui-fly-pos76cebb3ec86a41ccaf09c192b06b1a1e__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>Experts examine how supply chains can help improve the availability of life-saving commodities.</p></description><pubDate>Wed, 17 Dec 2014 14:01:56 -0800</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>David Sarley</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/D/DA-DE/david-sarley-frui-fly-pos76cebb3ec86a41ccaf09c192b06b1a1e__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Vaccines</topic><program>Health</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{FA772746-795F-4364-A8B9-5E2707AD8A82}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/12/On-the-Path-to-Polio-Eradication-Ensuring-Lasting-Protection</link><a10:author><a10:name>Jos  Vandelaer, Michel  Zaffran</a10:name></a10:author><title>On the Path to Polio Eradication: Ensuring Lasting Protection</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/12/On-the-Path-to-Polio-Eradication-Ensuring-Lasting-Protection"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/Other/Other/20140923nepalipvintr6fcde565e51449a4aa0762dd63c5a200__autocropped_list_post_autocropped.jpg?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>What would it take to introduce a vaccine into 126 countries\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdincluding those with the world\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds weakest health systems\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdin two and a half years? Eighteen months ago, we were approached with that following request: Could we coordinate efforts to support over  120 countries to add the injectable inactivated polio vaccine (IPV) into their routine immunization programmes before the end of 2015?</p></description><pubDate>Wed, 17 Dec 2014 09:00:00 -0800</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Jos  Vandelaer, Michel  Zaffran</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/Other/Other/20140923nepalipvintr6fcde565e51449a4aa0762dd63c5a200__autocropped_list_post_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Polio|Vaccines</topic><program>Health</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{13DA0B90-93ED-4D05-BCE3-CBC2293FE463}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/12/Simple-But-Impactful-Transforming-Nigerias-Vaccine-Supply-Chain</link><a10:author><a10:name>Inuwa Yau, Mahmud Mustapha Zubair</a10:name></a10:author><title>Simple But Impactful: Transforming Nigeria\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Vaccine Supply Chain </title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/12/Simple-But-Impactful-Transforming-Nigerias-Vaccine-Supply-Chain"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/N/NF-NI/nigeria-dashboard-trainerd302d8b4bf9a4e2aa21f0efef5b2eec8__autocropped_list_post_autocropped.jpg?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>The new national vaccine stock performance management dashboard is helping Nigeria improve supply chain management for life-saving vaccines.</p></description><pubDate>Tue, 16 Dec 2014 13:08:15 -0800</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Inuwa Yau, Mahmud Mustapha Zubair</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/N/NF-NI/nigeria-dashboard-trainerd302d8b4bf9a4e2aa21f0efef5b2eec8__autocropped_list_post_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Vaccines</topic><program>Health</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{20A23080-796A-44EC-9354-9605402E8733}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/11/The-Gift-of-Good-Health--GivingTuesday</link><a10:author><a10:name>Orin Levine</a10:name></a10:author><title>The Gift of Good Health - #GivingTuesday</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/11/The-Gift-of-Good-Health--GivingTuesday"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/G/GF-GI/giving-tuesday-global-3751ea53878843c280d65e6c63e9ec2d__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>On Giving Tuesday, your donation to Shot@Life could help a child receive the life-saving gift of vaccines.</p></description><pubDate>Mon, 24 Nov 2014 04:03:53 -0800</pubDate><numberOfComments>0</numberOfComments><author>Orin Levine</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/G/GF-GI/giving-tuesday-global-3751ea53878843c280d65e6c63e9ec2d__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Vaccines</topic><program>Health</program></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">{E290EC25-D018-4A1E-8A40-A680743E5E25}</guid><link>http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/10/Supply-Chains-for-Global-Health</link><a10:author><a10:name>David Sarley</a10:name></a10:author><title>Supply Chains for Global Health</title><description><div style="text-align: left; "><a href="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/Posts/2014/10/Supply-Chains-for-Global-Health"><img src="http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/A/AJ-AO/akutan-fleet-rdh-12720174abd0d93ffa4b2ca4dcdf72fcb521b2__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110" style="border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; margin: 4px;" /></a></div><p>The experience and advice from Starbucks, Trident Seafoods and Microsoft can help public health supply chain members improve their on-time and in-full order fulfilment, ensuring life-saving commodities are available when they are needed.</p></description><pubDate>Tue, 21 Oct 2014 13:04:00 -0700</pubDate><numberOfComments>3</numberOfComments><author>David Sarley</author><postImage type="rollup">http://www.impatientoptimists.org/~/media/Blog/Images/BlogPosts/List-Archive-Thumbnail/A/AJ-AO/akutan-fleet-rdh-12720174abd0d93ffa4b2ca4dcdf72fcb521b2__autocropped_lat_autocropped.jpg?w=110</postImage><topic>Vaccines</topic><program>Health</program></item></channel></rss>
